summary: Build a private Finance Budget Planner web page that collects essential inputs with optional advanced sections, applies smart default budgeting rules when data is missing, and outputs a personalized budget with visuals, recommendations, action plan, and a finance health score.
architectural_notes: Planner form should support required minimal inputs plus optional expandable sections with a clear 'skip' path; when optional inputs are missing, use default averages and safe budgeting rules (e.g., 50/30/20 or 60/30/10) and clearly label assumptions in results.

existing_features.title: Create a new authenticated (private) "Budget Planner" page that is only accessible when the user is logged in, matching the existing private-route pattern under AppLayout.

Implement the Budget Planner input form with a clearly separated Required section and an expandable "Advanced Details (Optional)" section that can be skipped, using English labels and helper text that clearly marks optional fields.

Add a progress indicator for the form completion (e.g., "You're 60% done") that updates based on completion of required fields and (optionally) advanced fields, and ensure the layout is mobile-first and easy to complete on small screens.

Implement "smart handling" budgeting logic that can generate a basic plan from only the required inputs; when optional inputs are skipped, apply safe default averages and standard budgeting rules (50/30/20 or 60/30/10) and clearly label all assumptions used in the results.

Build the Budget Output section that includes: income summary, Needs/Wants/Savings allocation, suggested savings amount, visual insights (expense pie chart, savings progress bar, cash flow summary), smart recommendations, a 3-step action plan for the month, and a Finance Health Score out of 100 with a simple explanation.

Add UX and privacy-first messaging on the Budget Planner page explaining that the tool is private and that users can generate a plan with minimal data; ensure the tone is friendly and non-judgmental throughout.

Add an optional "Reminder setup" affordance in the Action Plan section that does not rely on push notifications, SMS, email, or external services (e.g., a simple local-only reminder UI or a downloadable calendar reminder file).
Update the authenticated app navigation to include a "Budget Planner" entry that routes to the new private Budget Planner page, consistent with the existing sidebar/mobile menu patterns.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a private Finance Budget Planner page with required inputs, expandable optional advanced details, smart default budgeting logic, and rich budget outputs (charts, recommendations, action plan, finance health score, privacy-first UX, progress indicator).

projectName: Add private Finance Budget Planner page with optional advanced inputs and smart budget output
